fields.description:
*Assessment*

Cloudformation {{AWS::EC2::Instance}} resource with the following {{NetworkInterfaces}} property definition:
{code}
..
                    "NetworkInterfaces" : [{
                        "GroupSet" : [{ "Ref" : "SecurityGroup" }],
                        "AssociatePublicIpAddress" : "true",
                        "DeviceIndex"  : "0",
                        "SubnetId"  : { "Ref" : "Subnet" }
                    },{
                        "GroupSet" : [{ "Ref" : "SecurityGroup2" }],
                        "AssociatePublicIpAddress" : "false",
                        "DeviceIndex"  : "1",
                        "SubnetId"  : { "Ref" : "Subnet" }
                    }],
..
{code}
Results with the following error in the stack events:
{code}
...
EVENT	InstanceTest	00e16d23-1c8c-4ba2-a5fb-d75cc76328f4	AWS::CloudFormation::Stack	InstanceTest	arn:aws:cloudformation::002598321247:stack/InstanceTest/d4875f42-6086-48cc-b713-78d89e284421	2016-09-29T14:13:22.784Z	UPDATE_ROLLBACK_IN_PROGRESS	The following resource(s) failed to update: [IPAddress].
EVENT	InstanceTest	IPAddress-UPDATE_FAILED-1475158401112	AWS::EC2::EIP	IPAddress	10.116.155.202	2016-09-29T14:13:21.112Z	UPDATE_FAILED	expected one element but was: <com.eucalyptus.compute.common.internal.vpc.NetworkInterface@34587543, com.eucalyptus.compute.common.internal.vpc.NetworkInterface@f51810ab>
...
{code}

This same template used on AWS returns the following error in stack events:
{code}
...
STACKEVENTS	Instance-UPDATE_FAILED-2016-09-28T17:43:18.331Z	Instance	i-6e69ef76	{"KeyName":"marketing-hspencer-admin","UserData":"I2Nsb3VkLWNvbmZpZwphcHRfdXBkYXRlOiB0cnVlCmFwdF91cGdyYWRlOiB0cnVlCmRpc2FibGVfcm9vdDogdHJ1ZQpydW5jbWQ6CiAtIFsgYXB0LWdldCwgaW5zdGFsbCwgLXksIHB5dGhvbi1zZXR1cHRvb2xzIF0KIC0gWyBhcHQtZ2V0LCBpbnN0YWxsLCAteSwgbWxvY2F0ZSBdCiAtIFsgYXB0LWdldCwgaW5zdGFsbCwgLXksIG5naW54IF0K","NetworkInterfaces":[{"DeviceIndex":"0","GroupSet":["sg-416fc238"],"SubnetId":"subnet-b9bf86dd","AssociatePublicIpAddress":"true"},{"DeviceIndex":"1","GroupSet":["sg-3069c449"],"SubnetId":"subnet-b9bf86dd","AssociatePublicIpAddress":"false"}],"ImageId":"ami-167ba776","BlockDeviceMappings":[{"VirtualName":"ephemeral0","DeviceName":"/dev/sdc"},{"Ebs":{"VolumeSize":"8","DeleteOnTermination":"true"},"DeviceName":"/dev/sdd"}],"InstanceType":"m3.medium","Tags":[{"Value":"arn:aws:cloudformation:us-west-2:017179026131:stack/InstanceTest/4fa55410-85a2-11e6-a7d2-50a68a2012f2","Key":"Application"}]}
	UPDATE_FAILED	The associatePublicIPAddress parameter cannot be specified when launching with multiple network interfaces.	AWS::EC2::Instance	arn:aws:cloudformation:us-west-2:017179026131:stack/InstanceTest/4fa55410-85a2-11e6-a7d2-50a68a2012f2	InstanceTest	2016-09-28T17:43:18.331Z
STACKEVENTS	Instance-UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS-2016-09-28T17:43:17.877Z	Instance	i-6e69ef76	{"KeyName":"marketing-hspencer-admin","UserData":"I2Nsb3VkLWNvbmZpZwphcHRfdXBkYXRlOiB0cnVlCmFwdF91cGdyYWRlOiB0cnVlCmRpc2FibGVfcm9vdDogdHJ1ZQpydW5jbWQ6CiAtIFsgYXB0LWdldCwgaW5zdGFsbCwgLXksIHB5dGhvbi1zZXR1cHRvb2xzIF0KIC0gWyBhcHQtZ2V0LCBpbnN0YWxsLCAteSwgbWxvY2F0ZSBdCiAtIFsgYXB0LWdldCwgaW5zdGFsbCwgLXksIG5naW54IF0K","NetworkInterfaces":[{"DeviceIndex":"0","GroupSet":["sg-416fc238"],"SubnetId":"subnet-b9bf86dd","AssociatePublicIpAddress":"true"},{"DeviceIndex":"1","GroupSet":["sg-3069c449"],"SubnetId":"subnet-b9bf86dd","AssociatePublicIpAddress":"false"}],"ImageId":"ami-167ba776","BlockDeviceMappings":[{"VirtualName":"ephemeral0","DeviceName":"/dev/sdc"},{"Ebs":{"VolumeSize":"8","DeleteOnTermination":"true"},"DeviceName":"/dev/sdd"}],"InstanceType":"m3.medium","Tags":[{"Value":"arn:aws:cloudformation:us-west-2:017179026131:stack/InstanceTest/4fa55410-85a2-11e6-a7d2-50a68a2012f2","Key":"Application"}]}
	UPDATE_IN_PROGRESS	Requested update requires the creation of a new physical resource; hence creating one.	AWS::EC2::Instance	arn:aws:cloudformation:us-west-2:017179026131:stack/InstanceTest/4fa55410-85a2-11e6-a7d2-50a68a2012f2	InstanceTest	2016-09-28T17:43:17.877Z
...
{code}

*Steps*

# Create stack using linked {{cfn-instance-test-update5.json}} template with EBS-backed EMI:
{code}
[root@g-22-04 ~]# euform-create-stack InstanceTest --template-file cfn-instance-test-update5.json --parameter ImageId=emi-beae1914 --parameter KeyName=sales-admin --region sales-admin@
arn:aws:cloudformation::002598321247:stack/InstanceTest/d4875f42-6086-48cc-b713-78d89e284421
[root@g-22-04 ~]# euform-describe-stacks --region sales-admin@
STACK	InstanceTest	CREATE_COMPLETE		Cloudformation UpdateStack #5: Replace instance store-backed HVM with EBS-backed instance with block device mappings	2016-09-29T13:57:50.439Z
PARAMETER	ImageId		emi-beae1914
PARAMETER	InstanceType		m1.medium
PARAMETER	KeyName		sales-admin
OUTPUT	InstanceId	i-003b8d01
OUTPUT	AZ	ds2
OUTPUT	PublicIP	10.116.155.202
{code}
# Run UpdateStack with deployed stack using linked {{cfn-instance-test-update6.json}} template:
{code}
[root@g-22-04 ~]# euform-update-stack InstanceTest --template-file cfn-instance-test-update6.json --parameter ImageId=emi-beae1914 --parameter KeyName=sales-admin --region sales-admin@
arn:aws:cloudformation::002598321247:stack/InstanceTest/d4875f42-6086-48cc-b713-78d89e284421
[root@g-22-04 ~]# euform-describe-stacks --region sales-admin@
STACK	InstanceTest	UPDATE_ROLLBACK_COMPLETE		Cloudformation UpdateStack #5: Replace instance store-backed HVM with EBS-backed instance with block device mappings	2016-09-29T13:57:50.439Z
PARAMETER	ImageId		emi-beae1914
PARAMETER	InstanceType		m1.medium
PARAMETER	KeyName		sales-admin
OUTPUT	InstanceId	i-003b8d01
OUTPUT	AZ	ds2
OUTPUT	PublicIP	10.116.155.202
{code}

{code}

fields.summary: CFN: 'associatePublicIPAddress' error not returned when Instance resource contains multiple network interfaces

comments.body: This is the negative case, the correct request works.

The attached template can be used to more simply reproduce the issue. We now respond with the same error as aws/ec2 when launching an instance with incorrect use of the associatePublicIPAddress parameter:

{code}
#
#
# euform-create-stack --template-file instance_invalid_template.json -p ImageId=emi-518980b3 -p SubnetId=subnet-2e5af7f7 instance-stack-1
arn:aws:cloudformation::000174336380:stack/instance-stack-1/eb933686-14bd-4eb6-b81f-9434d481b969
#
#
# euform-describe-stack-events instance-stack-1
EVENT	instance-stack-1	0c499fcc-7da3-46e1-8e72-7648768cd5ae	AWS::CloudFormation::Stack	instance-stack-1	arn:aws:cloudformation::000174336380:stack/instance-stack-1/eb933686-14bd-4eb6-b81f-9434d481b969	2016-10-19T06:01:30.925Z	CREATE_FAILED	The following resource(s) failed to create: [Instance].
EVENT	instance-stack-1	Instance-CREATE_FAILED-1476856890632	AWS::EC2::Instance	Instance		2016-10-19T06:01:30.632Z	CREATE_FAILED	The associatePublicIPAddress parameter cannot be specified when launching with multiple network interfaces.
EVENT	instance-stack-1	Instance-CREATE_IN_PROGRESS-1476856890422	AWS::EC2::Instance	Instance		2016-10-19T06:01:30.422Z	CREATE_IN_PROGRESS	
EVENT	instance-stack-1	b8cc1271-e026-4fdb-901f-4f9676aafe56	AWS::CloudFormation::Stack	instance-stack-1	arn:aws:cloudformation::000174336380:stack/instance-stack-1/eb933686-14bd-4eb6-b81f-9434d481b969	2016-10-19T06:01:30.013Z	CREATE_IN_PROGRESS	User Initiated
#
#
{code}

Verified that EC2-compatible 'associatePublicIPAddress' is returned:

{noformat}

arn:aws:cloudformation::000122946064:stack/euca-12790/d5230b4b-be3b-4655-8871-04a9275e3307
